Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the FLARE™ Imaging System for Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping in Breast Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included adult women scheduled for SLN mapping.

Intervention.evidence: Participants received 99m Tc-sulfur colloid lymphoscintigraphy and 12.5 µg of indocyanine green (ICG) in human serum albumin (HSA) as an NIR fluorescent tracer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the number of SLNs identified by NIR fluorescence compared to 99m Tc-lymphoscintigraphy, assessed intraoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the intervention's nature.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at a single surgical center, involving 6 women undergoing sentinel lymph node (SLN) mapping for breast cancer.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on a per-protocol basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A total of 9 SLNs were identified by both 99m Tc-lymphoscintigraphy and NIR fluorescence, with discrepancies in two patients.
